channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2024010107
item.description:
Report E-2024010107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2929 Sulfix 9272 Scavenger release from (2) 330-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 70-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor and a 20’ x 20’ area of the asphalt lot below. The totes were punctured by metal sticking out from the trailer wall. Each tote was transferred into two new totes for shipment on. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly, (3) 55-gallon metal, and (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The two damaged totes were then cut up and containerized into (1) 95-gallon poly and (1) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010334
item.description:
Report X-2024010334

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-26
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called out for an Admin to contain the shipment. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a loose lid which led to the leakage. The bottle with the loose lid is empty of contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous material spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024010359

Report X-2024010359

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in corrugated carton with corrugated spacer insert. One jug crushed. Loose caps came off two jugs and spilled contents, soiling other jugs and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to the load side TRAILER 565392 due to a wet pkg. that the loader noticed when loading and pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage. DescribePack: Closures on 2 bottles came loose and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 20 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: A Fully regulated package came to QA wet and soiled after inspection loose caps on bottles caused the spill soiling the box and other contents in the box DescribePack: loose caps and punctured bottles caused the spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was brought to QA for inspection in a lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023120652
item.description:
Report X-2023120652

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package discovered leaking on load side after it was scanned to a trailer. Upon inspection a loose cap was determined to be the cause of the leak. Package was placed into a damaged hazmat tote complete with liner however, orientation arrows were not initially observed which caused additional leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap no seal on contents. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into damage tote with liner. Initially orientation arrows were not observed, once noticed position of package righted.

item.title: Report X-2023120681
item.description:
Report X-2023120681

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-10
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to unload trailer 554502 due to a leaking hazmat and when QA arrived pkg. was leaking out and QA placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage to get inspected. DescribePack: Inner cans were punctured and dented on bottom due to there were no slotted partitions from keeping the inner cans pressing up against each other and causing cans to get punctured and dented. And liquid was leaking out of the bottom of the cans where the dents were. DurationRel: 13 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.
